intro: Cryptantha glareosa var. longiseta, commonly known as the long-hairs bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which are covered in fine, glandular trichomes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
